column1: # Names of cognate sets, with indication of the original context
# The column COGNATE lists the names as used in the naming of the alignment files.
# The columns COGNATE_ID lists the COGIDs as used in the file "words.csv".
# e.g. /PAD/alignments/corrected/abend_1001.mca is a valid path to an alignment file.
# All COGNATE_IDs starting from 1188 in the file "words.csv" do not have an alignment file
# They occur only incidentally in the data (maximally 12 occurrences for "Zaterdag" and "Pfinztag")
# The column NUMBER_OF_WORDS lists how many words are available for in each alignment.
# The column WENKER_ID lists the number of sentence in which this word occurs (cf. http://staff-www.uni-marburg.de/~naeser/wenker.htm).
# The column WENKER_SENTENCE shows the original context in which the words occurred.
# Note that there are a few words that occur multiple times in the text.
# We have no way to reconstruct which of these occurrences were selected in the phonetic transcription.
# We have chosen one context here to represent each cognate set
# Weekdays and numerals were collected separately, so when not present in the sentences, they are marked as NA.
